p:
To test the ability of our adjusted model to describe individual focus growth by cell-to-cell transmission, we fit it to the same simulated data. The adjusted model (aCC-model, Equation ( 11) with
β f
=
δ T
=
δ I
= 0
, see also Table 1) provides a visibly better description of the growth dynamics than the standard CC-model ( Figure 4A). Model fits are significantly improved (
Δ AICc = 823.1
compared to
Δ AICc = 29.2
for the CC- and aCC-model, respectively) and with the adjusted cell-to-cell transmission rate,
f c
( I )
β c
, we are able to explain the decreasing growth rate of a focus over time.
